Headline: Yellow Line Service Temporarily Suspended
ShortDescription: Yellow Line service is still temporarily suspended due to an obstruction at Dodge.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Yellow Line service is still temporarily suspended due to an obstruction at Dodge. 

At this time, also consider other service alternatives that may serve your trip, such as nearby bus routes, or using buses to other rail lines.

These may include: #97 Skokie buses.

  • As a result of the delay, shuttle buses are available from Dempster-Skokie to Howard to provide connecting service in both directions.

We are working to restore service as soon as possible. We apologize for the inconvenience and appreciate your understanding.

Allow extra travel time.

Headline: Green and Pink Line Service Experiencing Significant Delays Due to Raised Bridge
ShortDescription: Green and Pink Line service is experiencing delays due to a raised bridge at the Chicago River, downtown.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Green and Pink Line service is experiencing delays due to a raised bridge at the Chicago River, downtown.

Some trains may be held or turned back before reaching the bridge in order to maintain service across the remainder of the route. Listen for announcements and check train destination signs when boarding.

We apologize for this temporary inconvenience and appreciate your patience while the Chicago Department of Transportation works to complete the bridge lift operation. 

Allow extra travel time.
